result.execSummary:
The defendant William A Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.   Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation waived by parties.
Total length of sentence:  36 months.
Initial term of confinement:  18 months WSP
Length of extended supervision:  18 months w/conditions.
Sentence is consecutive to Dane Co. case 14-CF-2208.
Def. is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
to suppress evidence; filed by Atty D Bielski.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bielski files suppression motion; makes speedy trial demand.  MH set for 8/25/16 at 3:30pm; JS set for 10/3/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
With Atty Bielski the STC of 8/15/16 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, as Atty Bielski has yet to meet w/the deft; reset to 8/17/16 at 11am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bielski needs time to discuss case w/deft.  STC continued to 8/15/16 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
from the deft regarding his motion to suppress jh
With Atty Bielski the STC of 6/28/16 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, as the deft's sentencing in Dane County was reset to 7/13/16, reset to 8/10/16 at 8:45am.

With Atty Bielski and by agreement of ADA McNeill and the court, the MH of 6/2/16 at 3:30pm is removed from the calendar as Atty Bielski will not be filing a motion to suppress, also the deft was recently revoked and will be sentenced in Dane County on 6/8/16, Atty Bielski to advise on where deft is located; a STC is set for 6/28/16 at 1:15pm.

Judge Barbara A. Kluka, Acting Br. 6 today only.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Phan believes that Atty Bielski intends to file a suppression motion.  Atty Bielski agrees, states he will file motion by the end of this week.  MH 6/2/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
